Simple sequentially scored survey
======================================

The following defines three Likert scale questions, and stores the GUI answers to a `results` 
object.

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library('mirtCAT')

## Define empty list of questions
questions <- list()

## Potential choices for each item (can be unique for each item)
choices <- c('Strongly Disagree', 'Disagree', 'Neutral',
             'Agree', 'Strongly Agree')

## Define question inputs and variable lables
questions$Q1 <- radioButtons(inputId = 'Q1',
                             label = 'Building tests with mirtCAT is difficult.',
                             choices = choices)
questions$Q2 <- radioButtons(inputId = 'Q2',
                             label = 'Building tests with mirtCAT requires a lot of coding.',
                             choices = choices)
questions$Q3 <- radioButtons(inputId = 'Q3',
                             label = 'Building tests with mirtCAT is fantastic.',
                             choices = choices)

## Run the mirtCAT web interface and store results
results <- mirtCAT(questions)
```
